definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come

sentences.english: So long lives this, and this gives life to thee.
sentences.chinese: 我的詩便能活着，使你的生命萬古流芳。

sentences.english: As a people's hero, Dong Cunrui has a niche in the temple of fame.
sentences.chinese: 董存瑞作爲一名人民英雄而流芳百世。

sentences.english: Ma Ying-jeou, is candidate for the Man of Never Dies.
sentences.chinese: 馬英九，流芳千古的候選人。

sentences.english: Red wine popple sweet in glass.
sentences.chinese: 通透的玻璃杯盪漾着美酒流芳。

sentences.english: A small imperishable poem is enough if you want to leave a good name to posterity.
sentences.chinese: 倘想流芳千古，一首不朽的小詩足矣。

sentences.english: The scientist's name will live on from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 這位科學家的名字將流芳百世。

sentences.english: Mozart is dead but his music lives on .
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特死了，但他的音樂流芳百世。

sentences.english: His name will resound through ages.
His dream was to be an architect and to leave his name in posterity.
sentences.chinese: 他夢想成爲一名建築師，流芳百世。

sentences.english: In the world market exist a plus products with low quality goods, but the same word "investment" mean an product that lasts.
sentences.chinese: 但是既然是“投資”，意味着它應該流芳百世。

sentences.english: If you want your name to be immortal, a good short poem will do.
sentences.chinese: 倘想流芳千古，一首不朽的小詩足矣。

sentences.english: Fang Jian-US point of numerous snacks, taste of the cheek teeth is Liufang.
sentences.chinese: 坊間小喫美點不勝枚舉，嘗之令人齒頰流芳。

sentences.english: Don't go out of the spring fragrance, recalling the stream.
sentences.chinese: 勿彷徨，脫素裹着春裝，憶流芳。

sentences.english: Baiyun liufang, wish to send your side.
sentences.chinese: 白雲流芳，祝福送你身旁。

sentences.english: It should ensure Michael goes down in history as the greatest artist of all time.
sentences.chinese: 這使得邁克爾成爲史上最偉大的藝術家流芳百世。

definition: for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
the Book of Songs 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] and Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]/a cultured well-read person
to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
to bring honor to one's ancestors and benefit future generations (idiom)
a good reputation to last a hundred generations
to ladle out/to dip/to pour out
